skill.name: nodejs-backend-patterns
skill.description: Build production-ready Node.js backend services with Express/Fastify, implementing middleware patterns, error handling, authentication, database integration, and API design best practices. Use when creating Node.js servers, REST APIs, GraphQL backends, or microservices architectures.
skill.summary: Build production-ready Node.js backend services with Express/Fastify, implementing middleware patter...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing code examples and architectural patterns for Node.js backend development. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no system command execution. All content is static documentation meant for user reference.

content.value_statement: Creating Node.js backend services requires understanding middleware patterns, authentication flows, and database integration. This skill provides ready-to-use code patterns and architectural guidance for Express and Fastify frameworks.
actual_capabilities: Implement Express and Fastify server setup with security middleware
Design layered architecture with controllers, services, and repositories
Create authentication and authorization middleware with JWT
Build PostgreSQL and MongoDB database integration patterns
Add rate limiting, request logging, and error handling patterns
Implement caching strategies with Redis and dependency injection
limitations: Does not generate complete project structure or boilerplate code
Does not install dependencies or configure build tools
Does not test or validate existing code implementations
Does not deploy services or configure infrastructure

use_cases.title: Build REST APIs
use_cases.description: Create scalable REST APIs with proper middleware, validation, and error handling using Express or Fastify

use_cases.title: Design backend architecture
use_cases.description: Implement layered architecture with controllers, services, repositories, and dependency injection patterns

use_cases.title: Set up authentication
use_cases.description: Configure JWT authentication, role-based authorization, and secure password handling with bcrypt

prompt_templates.title: Server Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to set up an Express.js server with helmet, cors, compression, and request logging middleware

prompt_templates.title: Auth Middleware
prompt_templates.prompt: Create JWT authentication middleware for Express that validates Bearer tokens and attaches user to request

prompt_templates.title: Database Pattern
prompt_templates.prompt: Show the repository pattern for PostgreSQL with connection pooling, transaction support, and CRUD operations

prompt_templates.title: Error Handling
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a global error handler for Express with custom error classes and proper HTTP status codes

output_examples.input: Create an Express server with authentication and rate limiting
output: Server setup with helmet security, cors configuration, and compression middleware
Rate limiting using express-rate-limit with Redis store for distributed environments
JWT authentication middleware that validates tokens and handles unauthorized errors
Request logging middleware using pino for structured logging

best_practices: Use TypeScript for type safety and to prevent runtime errors in production backends
Implement proper error handling with custom error classes and global error handlers
Validate all input using Zod or Joi schemas before processing in business logic
anti_patterns: Hardcoding secrets or credentials directly in source code instead of using environment variables
Using synchronous methods or blocking operations that degrade server performance
Returning detailed error messages in production that expose internal implementation details

faq.question: What Node.js frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: This skill covers Express.js and Fastify with TypeScript. Both frameworks have extensive examples for routes, middleware, and plugins.

faq.question: What are the recommended database patterns?
faq.answer: PostgreSQL with pg connection pool and MongoDB with Mongoose ODM are covered with repository patterns and transaction support.

faq.question: How does this skill integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: Patterns are framework-agnostic in structure. JWT, bcrypt, and Redis patterns work with any Node.js backend framework.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill is pure documentation. No code is executed, no files are accessed, and no data leaves your environment.

faq.question: Why are my API routes not working?
faq.answer: Check that middleware order is correct, validation schemas match request structure, and error handlers are registered last.

faq.question: How is this different from other backend skills?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on production patterns including layered architecture, dependency injection, and enterprise error handling patterns.
